Very different atmosphere from the other 2 Bioshock games. Great story, with a great character, and one of the most beautiful game worlds ever created. The gameplay is tight but this game is special due to Columbia, its amazing design, and the drive to learn more about Elizabeth and her story.
M√ºkemmel bir ba≈ü yapƒ±tƒ±n son oyunu ve ilk iki oyundaki mantƒ±gƒ±n reverse edilmi≈ü ve kullanƒ±cƒ±ya √ßok √ßok daha iyi bir ≈üekilde sunulmu≈ü hali

So I just finished the game, and let me tell you, you're in for a wild ride.

First off, the graphics are gorgeous without requiring a powerful rig, and the audio design is pretty good. 

 For gameplay, the controls are tight and shooting in general is fun.  The powers from previous games are back, though I feel they didn't get nearly enough attention.  They seem more like novelties than useful abilities.  I would say the great guns are your best bet, but there is no weapon wheel like previous games, so if you want to have fun with all of them don't get attached to any of them.  This game has a loop of firefights and exploring for items in a metroidvania style.  Some weapons and upgrades require some digging and A LOT of searching, and while they're not required to progress, they will help immensely.

Now for the story.  Oh boy.
While the game has a lot of mature themes handled well, personally some of it comes off as a bit pretentious, but it's better than what other fps's have to offer.
Other than that, I won't say, because this is something you need to experience firsthand.  The characters and narrative are some of the most memorable and well-written I've seen in a videogame.  It is truly a work of art. 

9.5/10
You owe it to yourself to play this.

Been playing all of the Bioshock games all over again, it is always awesome returning to Columbia & Rapture from the brilliant story line to the powers and weapons nothing ever feels old and its good to see that they all hold up even now.

if you are looking for a new FPS to play then i highly suggest picking up the Bioshock Collection if you have not yet and are new to the franchise.

I played this game a while ago when it first came out on the Xbox, and boy did I buy it on the wrong platform. I thought it looked good on the Xbox but once i bought my gaming PC and re-played it, I was astonished. Graphics are still worthy to keep up to on today's standards with graphics on ultra in my opinion. Would recommend.

Hikayesi 7-8 saat arasƒ± ve gayet tatmin edici. Hikayenin ba≈üƒ±nda olanlarla sonunda olanlarƒ± baƒüda≈ütƒ±rmak cidden √ßok zor. Eƒüer sizi s√ºr√ºkleyip i√ßine √ßekecek bir hikaye ve ≈üa≈üƒ±rtƒ±cƒ± bir son istiyorsanƒ±z Bioshock ƒ∞nfinite tamda size g√∂re.

This would have the best game I've ever played and it will always remain my all time favorite. I love everything about it (maybe except the crappy auto saving system). The graphics are really pretty, the gameplay is better than the previous games and it is easier than the other versions but just bump up the difficulty. The story would be my favorite part about it. Never have I ever found a game with a story as unique as this one and I doubt I ever will. Finished it like 3 times already and I am thinking of going again. 11/10 would recommend playing.

es un juego bastante bueno me encanta su historia sus dise√±os conseptuales INPECABLES y por lo que mas destaca es su historia en lo personal y sus personajes son buenisimos y su conjunto de tres juegos es uma delice jajajaja

My goodness, what a game. I love FPS so game play wise this is right down my ally. the combination of different weapons and abilities are enjoyable and easy to use. The story is a masterpiece. It really is what makes playing single player games so satisfying. The atmosphere, music, combat, story all blend into a masterful storytelling that will leave you breathless by the end. Definitely recommend this game if you are interested in stories in gaming. This is by far one of the best games I've played this year, or ever. Highly Recommend!!

The Bioshock series always had its finger on the pulse of a story people didn't even know they wanted yet. Combo that with some interesting lore tidbits through collectable items, and a fun and action packed first person shooter, and you've got a great game that will become a favorite to many. I played it near when it came out and thought of it as the best Bioshock game, simply because the dark, cramped, and drowning corridors of the first two weren't my pace. The shift in intricacies of the worlds never clicked with me, either. Playing this again, recently, it became boldly clear how much I missed in the first game, and how much my brain made up for me. The story chugged along fine, and the "science" and history and feel of the world all felt like they could be legitimate, and my suspension of disbelief was solid. The gameplay was fun but hard at times (quite possibly because I suck, OR chose the Hard difficulty) but it was a good experience. 

My problem with the game is the necessity to keep the player in the dark until the very last moments of the game. Warning: small tangent to talk about Bioshock 1 and ALOT of spoilers for both games (skip to after the paragraph). In Bioshock 1, the big reveal of "Would you kindly" influenced the players final decisions of the game's story, and made for a unique experience. in my head, it played like this: if I was a hero, and spared life when I could, it would make me a guilty conscience or feel as though I had no control over my characters actions anyway. If I was the villain, and killed maliciously, it either made me feel like I was not at fault for my actions, or that the *entire* thing was just out of my control. That multi-layered reaction for the ending, and the decisions based on that reaction, were not present in Bioshock Infinite. The big bombs really had nothing to do with you. And when they did, you couldn't really do anything about it to influence how the story or ending occurred. 

That being said, I was still roped in by the art direction, gameplay and mechanics, and characters. It was a fleshed out world, just with a side salad of a story that dropped a bomb but didn't give the aftermath.

3.5 severed pinkies / 5. A good game, and a favorite still. But nothing to scream "GOTY" over.

Do you love saving a princess that's held within a castle by her daddy that rules a racist utopia in the sky with an iron first? Yes? No?
